oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery On The Record with Barbara Mandrell - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of Barbara Mandrell (performer) for Ralph Emery: On the Record With Barbara Mandrell. The recording is performed in front of a live audience. The recording is from June 23, 1995. The tape is labeled as part 2.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Barbara Mandrell
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Barbara Mandrell thanks Ralph Emery and praises Rush Limbaugh -- (01:10) Emery inquires about the tours Mandrell took to Vietnam during the Vietnam War -- (04:53) Emery asks Mandrell to recall the story of showering in Vietnam -- (06:49) Emery introduces the break to change tapes -- (07:50) Emery and Mandrell discuss Mandrell's musical childhood; additionally, Mandrell reflects on working as a minor in music -- (09:46) Emery inquires as to why Mandrell chose the steel guitar -- (10:14) Mandrell is invited to recall how she was asked to play in Vegas -- (11:10) An unidentified voice introduces Mandrell's time on the Town Hall Party Show -- (12:53) Emery asks Mandrell to reflect on how Mandrell met Johnny Cash and Patsy Cline -- (15:33) Emery invites Mandrell to reflect on her teenage years in California -- (18:08) Emery and Mandrell discuss Mandrell's marriage to Ken Dudney, and Mandrell reflects on retiring when she was eighteen -- (21:46) Emery inquires about Mandrell's first record: "I've Been Loving You Too Long to Stop Now" -- (22:25) Emery asks about the time between Mandrell's first successful record and the Barbara Mandrell and the Mandrell Sisters show -- (25:57) Emery plays a clip from Barbara Mandrell and the Mandrell Sisters show where Dolly Parton visited -- (26:54) Mandrell praises Parton, and Emery inquires about the health difficulties associated with production -- (29:13) Emery plays two clips of the times where Mandrell won the Entertainer of the Year award -- (31:20) Emery introduces the People's Choice Award -- (32:01) Emery plays a clip of the time where James Stewart presented Mandrell with the People's Choice Award -- (33:33) Mandrell praises Stewart, and Mandrell recalls an article that claimed to know Mandrell -- (35:05) Emery plays a clip from when Mandrell was on the Grand Ole Opry with Minnie Pearl and Roy Acuff -- (37:27) Emery and Mandrell praise Pearl, and Emery inquires about the possibility of a movie featuring Mandrell's life -- (41:45) Emery and Mandrell express their thanks for each other, and Mandrell recalls what Mandrell said when asked to be on the show -- (42:54) Emery and Mandrell converse and thank the crowd
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Mandrell, Barbara; Mandrell, Barbara, 1948-;
